block.p: Katherine Bauer Viener, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John D. Viener of New York, was married yesterday to Aidan J. Riordan, a son of Mr. and Mrs. John T. Riordan of Cotuit, Mass. The Rev. Richard Sears, a Congregational minister, officiated at the Mayflower Inn in Washington, Conn.

Mrs. Riordan, 25, is a marketing associate in New York with Global Asset Management, a mutual fund and investment management company. She graduated from the University of Pennsylvania. Her father, a founder of Christy & Viener, the New York law firm, is a partner in its successor, Salans Hertzfeld Heilbronn Christy & Viener.

Katherine Bauer Viener, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John D. Viener of New York, was married yesterday to Aidan J. Riordan, a son of Mr. and Mrs. John T. Riordan of Cotuit, Mass. The Rev. Richard Sears, a Congregational minister, officiated at the Mayflower Inn in Washington, Conn.

Mrs. Riordan, 25, is a marketing associate in New York with Global Asset Management, a mutual fund and investment management company. She graduated from the University of Pennsylvania. Her father, a founder of Christy & Viener, the New York law firm, is a partner in its successor, Salans Hertzfeld Heilbronn Christy & Viener.

Mr. Riordan, 28, graduated from Penn and in May received an M.B.A. degree from Columbia University. Next month, he is to become an associate in financial analysis at Castle Harlan Inc., a New York merchant bank. His father is the president and chief executive of the International Council of Shopping Centers, a trade association in New York.
